19namespace v8 {
20
21class PredictablePlatform final : public Platform {
22 public:
23 explicit PredictablePlatform(std::unique_ptr<Platform> platform)
24 : platform_(std::move(platform)) {
25 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(platform_);
26 }
27
28 PredictablePlatform(const PredictablePlatform&) = delete;
29 PredictablePlatform& operator=(const PredictablePlatform&) = delete;
30
31 PageAllocator* GetPageAllocator() override {
32 return platform_->GetPageAllocator();
33 }
34
35 void OnCriticalMemoryPressure() override {
36 platform_->OnCriticalMemoryPressure();
37 }
38
39 std::shared_ptr<TaskRunner> GetForegroundTaskRunner(
40 v8::Isolate* isolate) override {
41 return platform_->GetForegroundTaskRunner(isolate);
42 }
43
44 int NumberOfWorkerThreads() override {
45 // The predictable platform executes everything on the main thread, but we
46 // still pretend to have the default number of worker threads to not
47 // unnecessarily change behaviour of the platform.
48 return platform_->NumberOfWorkerThreads();
49 }
50
51 void PostTaskOnWorkerThreadImpl(TaskPriority priority,
52 std::unique_ptr<Task> task,
53 const SourceLocation& location) override {
54 // We post worker tasks on the foreground task runner of the
55 // {kProcessGlobalPredictablePlatformWorkerTaskQueue} isolate. The task
56 // queue of the {kProcessGlobalPredictablePlatformWorkerTaskQueue} isolate
57 // is then executed on the main thread to achieve predictable behavior.
58 //
59 // In this context here it is okay to call {GetForegroundTaskRunner} from a
60 // background thread. The reason is that code is executed sequentially with
61 // the PredictablePlatform, and that the {DefaultPlatform} does not access
62 // the isolate but only uses it as the key in a HashMap.
63 platform_
64 ->GetForegroundTaskRunner(
65 kProcessGlobalPredictablePlatformWorkerTaskQueue)
66 ->PostTask(std::move(task));
67 }
68
69 void PostDelayedTaskOnWorkerThreadImpl(
70 TaskPriority priority, std::unique_ptr<Task> task,
71 double delay_in_seconds, const SourceLocation& location) override {
72 // Never run delayed tasks.
73 }
74
75 bool IdleTasksEnabled(Isolate* isolate) override { return false; }
76
77 std::unique_ptr<JobHandle> CreateJobImpl(
78 TaskPriority priority, std::unique_ptr<JobTask> job_task,
79 const SourceLocation& location) override {
80 // Do not call {platform_->PostJob} here, as this would create a job that
81 // posts tasks directly to the underlying default platform.
82 return platform::NewDefaultJobHandle(this, priority, std::move(job_task),
83 NumberOfWorkerThreads());
84 }
85
86 double MonotonicallyIncreasingTime() override {
87 // In predictable mode, there should be no (observable) concurrency, but we
88 // still run some tests that explicitly specify '--predictable' in the
89 // '--isolates' variant, where several threads run the same test in
90 // different isolates. To avoid TSan issues in that scenario we use atomic
91 // increments here.
92 uint64_t synthetic_time =
93 synthetic_time_.fetch_add(1, std::memory_order_relaxed);
94 return 1e-5 * synthetic_time;
95 }
96
97 double CurrentClockTimeMillis() override {
98 return MonotonicallyIncreasingTime() * base::Time::kMillisecondsPerSecond;
99 }
100
101 v8::TracingController* GetTracingController() override {
102 return platform_->GetTracingController();
103 }
104
105 Platform* platform() const { return platform_.get(); }
106
107 private:
108 std::atomic<uint64_t> synthetic_time_{0};
109 std::unique_ptr<Platform> platform_;
110};
111
112std::unique_ptr<Platform> MakePredictablePlatform(
113 std::unique_ptr<Platform> platform) {
114 return std::make_unique<PredictablePlatform>(std::move(platform));
115}
116
117class DelayedTasksPlatform final : public Platform {
118 public:
119 explicit DelayedTasksPlatform(std::unique_ptr<Platform> platform)
120 : platform_(std::move(platform)) {
121 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(platform_);
122 }
123
124 explicit DelayedTasksPlatform(std::unique_ptr<Platform> platform,
125 int64_t random_seed)
126 : platform_(std::move(platform)), rng_(random_seed) {
127 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(platform_);
128 }
129
130 DelayedTasksPlatform(const DelayedTasksPlatform&) = delete;
131 DelayedTasksPlatform& operator=(const DelayedTasksPlatform&) = delete;
132
133 ~DelayedTasksPlatform() override {
134 // When the platform shuts down, all task runners must be freed.
135 DCHECK_EQ(0, delayed_task_runners_.size());
136 }
137
138 PageAllocator* GetPageAllocator() override {
139 return platform_->GetPageAllocator();
140 }
141
142 void OnCriticalMemoryPressure() override {
143 platform_->OnCriticalMemoryPressure();
144 }
145
146 std::shared_ptr<TaskRunner> GetForegroundTaskRunner(
147 v8::Isolate* isolate) override {
148 std::shared_ptr<TaskRunner> runner =
149 platform_->GetForegroundTaskRunner(isolate);
150
151 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&mutex_);
152 // Check if we can re-materialize the weak ptr in our map.
153 std::weak_ptr<DelayedTaskRunner>& weak_delayed_runner =
154 delayed_task_runners_[runner.get()];
155 std::shared_ptr<DelayedTaskRunner> delayed_runner =
156 weak_delayed_runner.lock();
157
158 if (!delayed_runner) {
159 // Create a new {DelayedTaskRunner} and keep a weak reference in our map.
160 delayed_runner.reset(new DelayedTaskRunner(runner, this),
161 DelayedTaskRunnerDeleter{});
162 weak_delayed_runner = delayed_runner;
163 }
164
165 return std::move(delayed_runner);
166 }
167
168 int NumberOfWorkerThreads() override {
169 return platform_->NumberOfWorkerThreads();
170 }
171
172 void PostTaskOnWorkerThreadImpl(TaskPriority priority,
173 std::unique_ptr<Task> task,
174 const SourceLocation& location) override {
175 platform_->CallOnWorkerThread(MakeDelayedTask(std::move(task)), location);
176 }
177
178 void PostDelayedTaskOnWorkerThreadImpl(
179 TaskPriority priority, std::unique_ptr<Task> task,
180 double delay_in_seconds, const SourceLocation& location) override {
181 platform_->CallDelayedOnWorkerThread(MakeDelayedTask(std::move(task)),
182 delay_in_seconds, location);
183 }
184
185 bool IdleTasksEnabled(Isolate* isolate) override {
186 return platform_->IdleTasksEnabled(isolate);
187 }
188
189 std::unique_ptr<JobHandle> CreateJobImpl(
190 TaskPriority priority, std::unique_ptr<JobTask> job_task,
191 const SourceLocation& location) override {
192 return platform_->CreateJob(priority, MakeDelayedJob(std::move(job_task)),
193 location);
194 }
195
196 double MonotonicallyIncreasingTime() override {
197 return platform_->MonotonicallyIncreasingTime();
198 }
199
200 double CurrentClockTimeMillis() override {
201 return platform_->CurrentClockTimeMillis();
202 }
203
204 v8::TracingController* GetTracingController() override {
205 return platform_->GetTracingController();
206 }
207
208 private:
209 class DelayedTaskRunnerDeleter;
210 class DelayedTaskRunner final : public TaskRunner {
211 public:
212 DelayedTaskRunner(std::shared_ptr<TaskRunner> task_runner,
213 DelayedTasksPlatform* platform)
214 : task_runner_(task_runner), platform_(platform) {}
215
216 bool IdleTasksEnabled() final { return task_runner_->IdleTasksEnabled(); }
217
218 bool NonNestableTasksEnabled() const final {
219 return task_runner_->NonNestableTasksEnabled();
220 }
221
222 private:
223 void PostTaskImpl(std::unique_ptr<Task> task,
224 const SourceLocation& location) final {
225 task_runner_->PostTask(platform_->MakeDelayedTask(std::move(task)),
226 location);
227 }
228
229 void PostNonNestableTaskImpl(std::unique_ptr<Task> task,
230 const SourceLocation& location) final {
231 task_runner_->PostNonNestableTask(
232 platform_->MakeDelayedTask(std::move(task)), location);
233 }
234
235 void PostDelayedTaskImpl(std::unique_ptr<Task> task,
236 double delay_in_seconds,
237 const SourceLocation& location) final {
238 task_runner_->PostDelayedTask(platform_->MakeDelayedTask(std::move(task)),
239 delay_in_seconds, location);
240 }
241
242 void PostIdleTaskImpl(std::unique_ptr<IdleTask> task,
243 const SourceLocation& location) final {
244 task_runner_->PostIdleTask(
245 platform_->MakeDelayedIdleTask(std::move(task)), location);
246 }
247
248 private:
249 friend class DelayedTaskRunnerDeleter;
250 std::shared_ptr<TaskRunner> task_runner_;
251 DelayedTasksPlatform* platform_;
252 };
253
254 class DelayedTaskRunnerDeleter {
255 public:
256 void operator()(DelayedTaskRunner* runner) const {
257 TaskRunner* original_runner = runner->task_runner_.get();
258 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&runner->platform_->mutex_);
259 auto& delayed_task_runners = runner->platform_->delayed_task_runners_;
260 DCHECK_EQ(1, delayed_task_runners.count(original_runner));
261 delayed_task_runners.erase(original_runner);
262 }
263 };
264
265 class DelayedTask final : public Task {
266 public:
267 DelayedTask(std::unique_ptr<Task> task, int32_t delay_ms)
268 : task_(std::move(task)), delay_ms_(delay_ms) {}
269
270 void Run() override {
271 base::OS::Sleep(base::TimeDelta::FromMicroseconds(delay_ms_));
272 task_->Run();
273 }
274
275 private:
276 std::unique_ptr<Task> task_;
277 int32_t delay_ms_;
278 };
279
280 class DelayedIdleTask final : public IdleTask {
281 public:
282 DelayedIdleTask(std::unique_ptr<IdleTask> task, int32_t delay_ms)
283 : task_(std::move(task)), delay_ms_(delay_ms) {}
284
285 void Run(double deadline_in_seconds) override {
286 base::OS::Sleep(base::TimeDelta::FromMicroseconds(delay_ms_));
287 task_->Run(deadline_in_seconds);
288 }
289
290 private:
291 std::unique_ptr<IdleTask> task_;
292 int32_t delay_ms_;
293 };
294
295 class DelayedJob final : public JobTask {
296 public:
297 DelayedJob(std::unique_ptr<JobTask> job_task, int32_t delay_ms)
298 : job_task_(std::move(job_task)), delay_ms_(delay_ms) {}
299
300 void Run(JobDelegate* delegate) override {
301 // If this job is being executed via worker tasks (as e.g. the
302 // {DefaultJobHandle} implementation does it), the worker task would
303 // already include a delay. In order to not depend on that, we add our own
304 // delay here anyway.
305 base::OS::Sleep(base::TimeDelta::FromMicroseconds(delay_ms_));
306 job_task_->Run(delegate);
307 }
308
309 size_t GetMaxConcurrency(size_t worker_count) const override {
310 return job_task_->GetMaxConcurrency(worker_count);
311 }
312
313 private:
314 std::unique_ptr<JobTask> job_task_;
315 int32_t delay_ms_;
316 };
317
318 std::unique_ptr<Platform> platform_;
319
320 // The Mutex protects the RNG, which is used by foreground and background
321 // threads, and the {delayed_task_runners_} map might be accessed concurrently
322 // by the shared_ptr destructor.
323 base::Mutex mutex_;
324 base::RandomNumberGenerator rng_;
325 std::unordered_map<TaskRunner*, std::weak_ptr<DelayedTaskRunner>>
326 delayed_task_runners_;
327
328 int32_t GetRandomDelayInMilliseconds() {
329 base::MutexGuard lock_guard(&mutex_);
330 double delay_fraction = rng_.NextDouble();
331 // Sleep up to 100ms (100000us). Square {delay_fraction} to shift
332 // distribution towards shorter sleeps.
333 return 1e5 * (delay_fraction * delay_fraction);
334 }
335
336 std::unique_ptr<Task> MakeDelayedTask(std::unique_ptr<Task> task) {
337 return std::make_unique<DelayedTask>(std::move(task),
338 GetRandomDelayInMilliseconds());
339 }
340
341 std::unique_ptr<IdleTask> MakeDelayedIdleTask(
342 std::unique_ptr<IdleTask> task) {
343 return std::make_unique<DelayedIdleTask>(std::move(task),
344 GetRandomDelayInMilliseconds());
345 }
346
347 std::unique_ptr<JobTask> MakeDelayedJob(std::unique_ptr<JobTask> task) {
348 return std::make_unique<DelayedJob>(std::move(task),
349 GetRandomDelayInMilliseconds());
350 }
351};
352
353std::unique_ptr<Platform> MakeDelayedTasksPlatform(
354 std::unique_ptr<Platform> platform, int64_t random_seed) {
355 if (random_seed) {
356 return std::make_unique<DelayedTasksPlatform>(std::move(platform),
357 random_seed);
358 }
359 return std::make_unique<DelayedTasksPlatform>(std::move(platform));
360}
361
